47 [Clement.]
SEint Clement was I-bore at Rome : I-furn bi olde dawe.
Of þe hexte men he was i-come : þa[t] weren in þulke lawe.
his Moder hiet Macidiane : his fader Faustinian.
Twei breþren he hadde, eldore þane he : heore namen ich telle kan :
Þat on hiet Faust, þat oþur Faustyn : twynnes boþe huy were;
Fader and moder weren glade of heom : þat heom bi-&yogh;ete and bere.
Swiþe fair womman heore Moder[added later.] was : þe faireste þat Men wuste;
hire louerd heo louede treweliche— : non-oþur of heom men nuste.
For hire fair-hede hire louerdes broþer : fondede with al[overlined.] is mi&yogh;te
To bringue hire in fole loue : bi dai&yogh;e and eke bi ny&yogh;te.
Þis guode womman was[MS. wast] studefast : he nolde nou&yogh;t don is wille;
Ake euere Ansuerede him fayre i-nov : and bar hire faire and stille.
he of-sou&yogh;te hire so swiþe : þat no pais heo nadde.
heo nust[e] &yogh;wat was hire beste red : ake sore of him heo dradde,
And þou&yogh;te &yogh;if heo tolde hire louerd fore : þat he wolde beo wroth
And þe more hatie is broþer— : þat were hire swiþe loth.
heo þou&yogh;te hou heo mi&yogh;te on take : þat heo ane &yogh;wyle nere
Ovt of is si&yogh;te in oþur stude : þat heo fur-&yogh;ite were.
heo hire bi-þou&yogh;te of one quoyntise : þat to hire louerd heo seide.[MS. leide?]
A ni&yogh;t In hire bed heo bi-gan to sike : ase þei heo of slepe a-breyde :
A, sire," heo seide, "merci, þin ore! : ich am in grete drede :
An hard metingue me hath i-mat : I-not &yogh;wat me is to rede :
Me þou&yogh;te þat on of ovre godes : cam here bi-fore þe
And hiet me greiþi hastifueliche : mine twei sones and me
And wiende with hem and wonie : feor In an oþur londe,
For-to ich oþur[MS. oþur oþur] heste hadde : of him oþur is sonde;
And bote &yogh;if ich sone dude so : he swor with grete oþe,
To luþere deþe he wolde do : us and ore children boþe.
Þare-fore, sire, bi-þench þe wel : &yogh;wat þar-of þov wolt rede :
For bote it beo sone ido : for-soþe we beoth dede."
Þis guode Man[overlined.] lai in grete care : And þene deth sore he dradde,
bi-þou&yogh;te him strete In swuche neode : þene beste red he radde :
Dame," he seide, "&yogh;wane it is so : to schilden us fram care
Þov schalt nime þine twei sones : a[n] to[MS. ato] Atenes fare.
Þov schalt habbe with þe men I-nowe : And tresor al-so.
Þov schalt, &yogh;wane þou þudere comest : þine sones to lore do,
Þat huy leornien of clergie. : and &yogh;wan ore god þe sent tokningue
For-to comen hom a-&yogh;ein : þov schalt heom with þe bringue."
Glad was þo þis guode wijf : of þat leoue rede.
heo greiþede hire and wende forth : ase hire louerd sede :
heo gan hire twei sones : toward atenes lede.
Ake seint clement athom with is fader : bi-lefde, for &yogh;ong-hede,
For he was onneþes fif &yogh;er old : and for þat he scholde beo
his fader solas, and[al. om.] for he nadde : bote childrene þreo.—
Þo þis guode wijf was forth i-went : and hire louerdes broþer it wuste
Þat hire louede in fole loue : no red þar-of he nuste;
¶ For wrathþe to is broþur he seide : sire, hov geth þis?
Is þi wijf fram þe I-went? : heo is strong hore, i-wis.
heo haueth me wel longue i-loued : ne[r. no] leng hele ich ne may,
And to bringue me in fole dede : heo fonde[de][MS. fonde] ni&yogh;t and day;
Onneþe ich me mi&yogh;te with hire wite : for, siker, i-nolde it do,
For sunne, ne for þe loue of þe : ne for mi treovnesse al-so.
Anon so heo it onder-&yogh;at : þat i-nolde don hire wille,
On of þine hynene heo louede : In folie wel stille,
Þat hath bi hire wel ofte i-leie. : ake, þat þov it ne onder-&yogh;ete,
heo þou&yogh;te hov heo mi&yogh;te with him beo— : for heo nolde him nou&yogh;t lete :
Þare-fore heo þou&yogh;te ane feolle wrench : of wommanes kuynde lore,
And is i-go with hire copiner : þov ne sixt hire nonmore.
For ofte men seggez, and soth it is : þat þis wommen beoth
Feolle and false, and þat[al. om.] me for-þinchez : þat we þe soþe i-seoth."
Sori was þis guode Man : þo he heorde þis,
Þat his wijf, þat he louede muche : scholde so don a-mis,
Ant þat heo was so fram him i-went : and þat heo ne bi-lefde bi-hinde
his sones, þat him so leoue weren : ne he nuste &yogh;ware heom finde.
After he wolde habbe i-went : ake he ne dorste for care
Of cleme[n]te, is &yogh;ongue sone : laste he scholde for-fare.[al. 2 vv. more.]—
Forth wende þis wijf with hire sones : ase god hire wolde sende.
In scipe heo dude hire in þe se : in-to an oþur londe to wende.
A-midde þe se a-&yogh;ein ane roche : þat schip bi-gan to glide,
Þat it alto-drof, and huy fullen out : euer-ech in is side.
A wawe þare cam of þe se : þoru ore louerdes sonde,
And caste þis guode wijf al quik : a-non-ri&yogh;t to þe londe.
A-non so heo was up i-cast : and to hire ri&yogh;te witte cam,
And miste hire twei leoue sones : gret deol to hire heo nam;
Into þe se heo wolde habbe i-lope : hire-seolf for-to a-drenche,
&YOGH;if it nadde i-beo for grete hope : of þing þat heo gan þenche :
Þat þe se wolde some tyme : hire sones to londe caste—
For men seggez heo wole ech ded þing : weorpen up atþe laste;
hadde heo enes heore bodies i-sei&yogh;e : hire þou&yogh;te þat heo ne rou&yogh;te.
Wide and longue heo &yogh;eode a-boute : and heore bodies sou&yogh;te.
Þo heo ne mi&yogh;te heom finde : heo &yogh;al and weop ful sore,
heo drov&yogh; of hire tressene and caste a-wei : for heo ne hopede to heom nonmore,
hire hondene heo wrong and to-gnov&yogh; : þat flesch, ri&yogh;t to þe bone,
And al-to-gnov&yogh; þe senewes : and made ful sori mone.
heo orn ase heo witles were : a-boute in-to al þe londe.
Wimmen[MS. wumnen] hadden of hire gret revþe : þat heo to[al. om.]-gnov so hire honde,
And fondeden &yogh;eorne to conforti hire : ake huy alle ne mi&yogh;ten make
Þat heo wolde into hire heorte : ani gladnesse take.
Into a wommanes hous heo cam : þat longue was bedrede,
Þat gret revþe hadde þo heo i-heorde : hire so weope and grede :
heo confortede hire, &yogh;wat so heo mi&yogh;te : and made hire bi-leue
with hire aldai, with glad semblaunt : for-to it was nei&yogh; eue.
So heo confortede þis guode wijf : þat heo bi-lefte þare at[at superscr.] Inne,
Mid[MS. And, al. And mid] weorke of hire hondene : hire liflode for[al. gan]-to winne,
With spinningue and with sevwyngue : þat heo wel couþe do;
Þare-with heo fedde hire swiþe wel : and hire ostesse al-so.
Sone þare-after þe senewes : of hire hondene bi-gonne to schrinke,
For heo heom hadde er so for-gnawe— : þat heo ne mi&yogh;te non-more swinke;
So þat heo ne mi&yogh;te i-welde : noþur Arm ne honde
to pulte enes mete to hire mouth : ase hit was godes sonde.
Þat deol þat heo made [þo] : no tongue it telle may.
Alas," heo seide, "þus longue i-leoued : and þat ich euere a-bod þis day!
For more sorewe þane me is on : neuere womman ne hadde.
Þe Ioye of mi louerd furst i for-les : for sunne þat ich dradde,
And bi-lefde clement mi &yogh;ongue : þat me was so leof, i-wis;
And sethþe les mine tweie sones in þe se : þat weren al mi blis;
And al one fram mine freond : þus feor in one-couþe londe
Mit deol and soruwe ich habbe i-leoued : þoru&yogh; swunch of mine honde :
Novþe mine hondene me beoth bi-nome : þat I-ne may heom enes wawe.
Alas, þus longue in care i-leoued : þat i-nere i-brou&yogh;t of lijf-dawe!"
Þat deol þat heo made : revþe it was to telle;
Ofte heo was ope þe pointe : hire-sulf for-to a-quelle.
Fram dore to dore hire mete heo bad : and with þat he mi&yogh;te I-winne,
heo fedde hire-sulf and hire hostesse : &yogh;wane heo cam to hire Inne.—
HIre louerd athom aftur hire : of-longet was wel sore,
And sente men to sechen hire : ake huy ne comen a-&yogh;ein nonmore.
Oþere he sente into al þat lond : and þo huy hadden longue i-sou&yogh;t,
huy comen a-&yogh;ein and tolden him : þat huy ne mi&yogh;ten hire finde nou&yogh;t.
Þo gan he Clement, is &yogh;ongue sone : In-to guode warde take,
And wend him-sulf into al þat lond : forto sechen is make.
he ne cam neuer-eft hom a-&yogh;ein— : wel wide he hire sou&yogh;te,
And &yogh;eode a-boute and bad is mete : þat of is lijf he ne rou&yogh;te.
¶ Twenti &yogh;er he bad is mete : and is wijf &yogh;eot wel mo.
he ful into feblesse of elde : þat vnneþe he mi&yogh;te go.[al. 2 vv. more.]
Seint clement, þis &yogh;ongue child : to clergie was i-do;
he i-werth sone a gret clerk : quoynte and guod al-so.
Þoru&yogh; his clergie him þou&yogh;te : þat heore lawe nas nau&yogh;t:
he wilnede muche to wyten of god : &yogh;if ani man him hadde i-tau&yogh;t.
HIt bi-feol þat seint Barnabe : Into Rome cam,
And clement hyne heorde a day : prechi of cristinedom:
So þat of þis holie Apostle : he lette him cristni a-non,
And bi-cam þe beste prechur : þat mi&yogh;te on eorþe gon.
he heorde telle of seint peter : þat In þe londe of Iudee was:
Are he to him were I-come : glad ne bliþe he nas:
he bi-cam is o desciple : and a-boute with him wende
For-to prechie cristine-dom : þoru&yogh; wit þat god him sende.
Symon Magus, þe luþere Man : &yogh;eode in Ane oþur londe,
To prechi a&yogh;ein Cristinedom : þoru&yogh; þe deoueles sonde.
Tweie desciples he hadde with him : þat, þo huy onder-&yogh;ete
Þe falshede þat with him was : huy gonne him sone for-lete;
To seint peter huy wenden a-non : and his desciples bi-come.
glad was seint peter of heom : and þonkede god i-lome.
SEint Clement tolde a day : to seint peter wel stille
hov hit of is freond bi-feol : as it was godes wille,
And al-hov is Moder &yogh;eode a-wei : with is breþren tweie,
Þat he wende þat huy a-dronke weren : oþur i-storue bi þe weie,
And hov is fader wende to sechen heom : þo he ne sai&yogh; oþur red;
And [he][om.] wende þat he were a-dreint : oþur for deole ded;
And hov frendles he was op i-brou&yogh;t : Into[al. & to] swyche lore.
Þo seint peter i-heorde þis : he gan to weope sore.—
Ase seint petur &yogh;eode a dai : prechinde ouer lond,
Ane womman, þat him þou&yogh;te gent and freo : In grete miseise he fond,
&YOGH;ware heo &yogh;eode and bad hire mete. : he Axede hire a-non
&YOGH;wy heo ne mi&yogh;te hire mete I-winne : and &yogh;wy heo wolde so gon.
ÞIs womman seide, "swuch day was : Ich couþe minne mete I|winne,
Ake nouþe mine hondene me beoth bi-nome : þat Ine may sevwy ne spinne.
More sorewe þane me is on : neuere nas i-founde;
Alas þat ich nadde me a-dreint : a-wei, þat ilke stounde!"
¶ Womman," seide seint peter þo : "folliche þov dest telle:
For þe Man þat him-seolfue a-slowe : his soule scholde into helle."
Sire," heo seide, "wuste ich þe soþe : þat soulene libbe scholde
After þusse liue, I-nolde bi-leue : þat me-seolf a-quelle i-nolde,
Þat Ich mi&yogh;te one stounde : mine sones i-seo;
I-ne rou&yogh;te sethþe, þei ich scholde : euer-eft in helle beo.
For mi louerd and mi[overlined.] &yogh;ongore sone : ich[MS. þat ich] bi-lefte at rome
And wende forth with mine tweie sones : ake þo we in þe se come,
Þat schip brak, and mine leoue sones : ne mi&yogh;ten neuereft beo i|founde;
Ake me heo caste to londe al quik : allas þulke stounde!
Ine mai for feblesse wende a-&yogh;ein : ne Ine habbe no man þat me lede,
And not &yogh;weþer mi louerd and mi &yogh;ongue sone : beon quike oþur dede."
Clement," seide seint peter : "þat min o desciple nouþe is,
Seith þat is fader and is moder : þis cas bi-feollen,[al. bifel] i-wis."
Þis womman feol a-don i-swowe : þo heo i-heorde þis.
Þo heo a-ros, heo cride &yogh;eorne : and weop for Ioie and blis,
And seide, "sire, þat is mi sone. : tech me &yogh;ware he beo!
Ine wilne mi lijf no leng to habbe : bote þat ich him enes i-seo."
Seint peter seide, "cum forth with me : to him ichulle þe lede.
Ake ne beo þov nou&yogh;t a-knowe to him : erore þane ich þe rede."
he nam þis wommane bi þe hond : and to hire sone hire brou&yogh;te.
Þo seint Clement i-sai&yogh; him lede ane womman : vuel bi him he þou&yogh;te,
And seide, "nouþe In þine olde liue : woltþou with wommane beo?"
So wroth he was þat vnneþe he wolde : toward him bi-seo.
¶ Þis guode wijf stod bi hire sone : heo ne mi&yogh;te for-bere non-more,
heo bi-cluppte him faste and custe a-non : for Ioye heo weop ful sore.
hire hondene þat hire weren bi-nome : anon-ri&yogh;t hole huy were,
For Ioye, and for grete vertue : of þe holie men þere.
SEint Clement was wroth with hire : for heo bi-clupte him and custe,[MS. clupte]
And in grete wrathþe hire pulte a-wei : and to þe grounde upri&yogh;t þruste.
Clement," seide seint peter þo : "darstþov þine moder pulte?
Þov cri hire Merci and lat þe schriue : for þine foule gulte!"
Louerd," seide seint cleme[n]t [þo] : "&yogh;weþur þis mi moder beo?
Louerd, i-hered beo þi mi&yogh;te : þat ich moste þis day i-seo!"
To is moder he ful a-doun : and bi-clupte hire and custe.
Welle, þe Ioye þat þare was : þo eiþur of oþur wuste!
Þis wyf seide, "leoue sone, þin ore : &yogh;weþur þi fader a-liue beo?"
Certes, moder," he seide, "i-not : Ine wene neuer-eft him i-seo.
Twenti &yogh;er it is ago : þat he After þe i-wende,
Þat neuer-eft Ine heorde word of him : ne he ne cam ne sende."
Þis guode wyf bi-gan to weope sore : ake natheles for blisse
Of hire sone þat heo hadde I-founde : hire seoruwe heo gan to lisse.
Euere stoden bi seint peter : his oþere desciples tweie
Þat fram symon Magus weren i-come to him : and &yogh;eorne bi|heolden beie;
huy i-heorden hou þis guode wyf tolde : to clemente, hire sone, þere,
hov hire tweie leoue sones : in þe se a-dreinte were.
Þo huy hadden þis tale i-heord : huy weren swiþe glad,
For Ioye huy stoden ase þei huy weren : witlese oþur[orig.and] a-mad.
louerd," huy seiden, "&yogh;weþer þis beo soth : þat we i-heorez nouþe telle,
oþur us þinchez ase in metingue : oþur in manere of spelle?"
hit is soth," seint peter seide : "oþur me þinchez &yogh;e beoth wode."
huy nusten &yogh;weþur to beon stille oþur speke : bote ase gydie men huy stode.
¶ Louerd," huy seiden, "here is ore Moder : þat a-dreint was ase we wende,
I-hered he beo þat hire hath to liue i-brou&yogh;t : And þat hire to us sende!
And þis is Clement, ore &yogh;ongue broþur : þat longue hath i-beo ore fere;
Nuste we neuere er &yogh;wat he was : are þoru&yogh; godes grace nouþe here."
Louerd, þe Ioye þat þe[re] was : And þat manie Mi&yogh;ten i-seo,
bi-twene þe guode wyf and hire sones : þe swete breþren þreo!
ÞIs guode wyf axede hire tweye sones : hov huy to liue come.
Dame," huy seiden, "ase god it wolde : a bord of þe schype we nome
And þar-on we hienguen, and hit bar us forth : into þe se wel wide.
Marineres us token into heore schipe : ase we floten heom bi-side.
Are huy us hadden to londe i-brou&yogh;t : huy nolden neuere a-fine.
To Ane holie wydewe huy solden us : þat hiet dame Iustine;
Þat us lokede nesche I-nov&yogh; : as þei we hire sones were,
And, god &yogh;ielde it hire! of clergie : heo liet us sone lere.
So þat we beoth nouþe godes desciples : and with his Apostle here.
Ore broþur clement we knoweth nouþe furst : þat &yogh;are hath i-beon ore fere.
And nouþe we beoth here to-gadere come : we mowen i-seo godes mi&yogh;te,
Þat euere wole mannes &yogh;wyle &yogh;elde : þat seruez him with ri&yogh;te."
Ech man wot wel þat þis I-heorth : þey we ne seggen it i-lome,
gret Ioye bi-twene heom alle was : þo huy to-gadere come.
¶ þis guode wyf heom tolde of hire hostesse : þat Innede hire bi ny&yogh;te,
Þat heo was a guod womman and was bedrade : &yogh;if huy hire hele mi&yogh;ten.
SEint petre hire let fette : and þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
Made hire hol, bi-fore al þat folk : anon in þulke place.—
Ase seint petre prechede a day : he seide in his prechingue
Þat, ho-so seruede ore louerd wel : scholde habbe guod endingue.
¶ Þo stod þare op a swiþe old man : his lockes weren ful hore;
pouere and stoupinde and miseise. : he bi-gan to siken sore.
gret revþe," he seide, "ich habbe of eov : þat &yogh;e bi-trayez men so;
Ech man bi-fallez ase his &yogh;wate is : &yogh;wat-so he euere do.
¶ For þei a man swyncke and crie on god : and bidde &yogh;eorne is bede,
him schal bi-falle, guod oþur vuel : ase it is him i-queþe.
Þei mani man beo wis and euere swynke : he ne may neuere bate;
And þei manie don vuele and euere folie : &yogh;eot he hath guod &yogh;wate."
¶ Seint petre hiet þe þreo breþren : þat is desciples were,
Despuyti a&yogh;ein þis olde man : of þat he tolde þere.
huy stoden and heore [r]esones[orig. oresones] seiden : þat ech man scholde a-fongue
After þat he wurche wolde : And elles it were with wrongue;
For, ho-so nath no guod, ne swinke nele : ne of porueance beo,
&YOGH;wat-so-euere man beo Iqueþe : he ne may it neuere fleo;[r. i-þeo]
And [ho]-so is wys to winne guod : and wel it witie can,
&YOGH;wat-so-euere is &yogh;wate beo : he worth riche man.
For ore louerd wole here and elles-&yogh;ware : &yogh;elden ane mannes seruise
After þat he him-seolf wurche wole : ake aftur &yogh;wate in none wise."
GRet clerk was þis olde Man : he desputede wel faste
A-&yogh;ein þe þreo breþren with gret reson. : þat playt wel longue laste.
Seint Clement was grettest clerk : þare-fore atþenende
Maister he was, þoru&yogh; grace : þat ore louerd him wolde sende.
Atþe laste þis olde Man : bi-gan to sike and grone,
And seid[e], "wel, icholde i-leue : ower resones ech-one,
&YOGH;if I-ne hadde to muche i-fondet : of þinge þat geth bi &yogh;wate.
Alas þulke soruful tyme : for mi confort cometh to late!
Riche man ich was elles-&yogh;ware : þei ich beo nouþe a wrechche here;
Ich hadde þreo &yogh;oungue children : and a guod wif þat was mi fere.
Mine tweie sones heo ladde awei : þo we heom hadden al bi-swonke :
Ine heorde neuereft word of heom : Ich wot huy beoth a-dronke.
Alle myne freond and al mi guod : Ich bi-lefte me bi-hynde
And habbe here i-walke in onkovþe londe : &yogh;if ich heom mi&yogh;te i-fynde.
Mi &yogh;ongeste child ich bi-lefte athom : Ich wene þat he beo ded.
